natural solution: Since the perimeter of the square is $48,$ its side length is $48 \div 4 = 12.$ Since the side length of the square is $12,$ its area is $12 \times 12 = 144.$ The area of the triangle is $\frac{1}{2} \times 48 \times x = 24x.$
Since the area of the triangle equals the area of the square, then $24x=144$ or $x=\boxed{6}.$
